intro: Stigmaphyllon florosum, commonly known as the Brazilian morning glory, is a climbing vine native to South America. It belongs to the Convolvulaceae family and is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers. The plant produces vibrant blue or violet flowers that bloom in the morning, hence its common name. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often found in moist, shaded environments. Its rapid growth and ornamental value make it a popular choice for horticultural use.
